I wanted to share some plans and thoughts about Irony development.

Read it in my Irony blog:

http://irony-roman.blogspot.com/2009/09/time-to-talk-about-future.html

Your feedback and comments are welcomed!

Thank you

Roman

I think your roadmap is good.  As for an exciting future enhancement, consider integrating Irony with SyntaxEditor from http://www.actiprosoftware.com.  SyntaxEditor 5.0, currently in beta for WPF, is designed to work with MGrammar, Antlr and any other parsing engine via the IParser interface.  There can be no better test case and adoption opportunity than something like SyntaxEditor.

Thanks for your feedback!

As for SyntaxEditor - not so sure... the problem is - it is propriatary control sold for price. Even if I do the integration (just as a test), I won't be able to use it in GrammarExplorer, or share it in general with other folks - running integrated solution would require having this control installed. On the other hand, seems like a good suggestion for ActiPro folks - to implement integration of their control with an open source solution...  I've seen suggestions  on their forums to look at integration with Irony - maybe they'll get to it

Roman
